transportAdvice: Tulum's town center and beach zone are several kilometers apart, making walking between them impractical for most visitors; renting a bicycle or scooter is a popular local option. Taxis and colectivos (shared minivans) are widely available and serve the main tourist corridors, though there is no formal metro or tram system.

weather.description: Dry and pleasant with warm days and cooler evenings, making it one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Continued dry conditions with slightly warming temperatures and low chance of rain.
Warm and mostly dry with increasing sunshine, ideal for beach and cenote activities.
Hot and dry with very little rainfall, great for outdoor exploration before the wet season begins.
Heat and humidity begin to build noticeably, with occasional afternoon showers signaling the approaching wet season.
Wet season is underway with frequent afternoon and evening thunderstorms, though mornings are often clear.
Hot and humid with regular rainfall; also falls within hurricane season, so weather can be unpredictable.
Peak of hurricane season brings the highest rainfall totals and heavy humidity throughout the day.
The wettest and most storm-prone month of the year, with a heightened risk of tropical systems affecting the region.
Rainfall begins to ease toward month's end, though humidity remains high and showers are still common.
Transitional month with decreasing rain and more comfortable temperatures as the dry season approaches.
Dry and warm with pleasant breezes, marking the return of peak tourist season and ideal beach weather.
